definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Powder River Pass cut through them.
They had arrived from another valley and were attempting an intricate series of crossings.
sentences.chinese: 他们来自另一个峡谷，打算穿越一系列复杂的隘口。

sentences.english: The Spartan King Leonidas led the army to the pass at Thermopylae.
sentences.chinese: 斯巴达国王里奥尼达斯率领军队前往塞莫皮莱隘口。

sentences.english: Keyboard and others before pass to observe the situation of the enemy, spike ridges defense.
sentences.chinese: 李剑等人在隘口前观察敌情，狼牙岭的防守甚严。

sentences.english: The hiker negociated the high mountain pass.
sentences.chinese: 这名徒步旅行者成功地登上了高山隘口。

sentences.english: A pass between two mountain peaks or a gap in a ridge.
sentences.chinese: 隘口，两个山峰间的通路或者山脊上的裂口。

sentences.english: There is a pass through the mountain range a few kilometres north of here.
sentences.chinese: 离这以北几公里，有个隘口穿过山脉。

definition: strategically situated and easy to defend/strategic location
Yamaguchi (Japanese surname and place name)/Yamaguchi prefecture in southwest of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]
to hold a pass/to guard (a strategic location)
